quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh! God. Dwight, come on...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I wanted to talk to you about the downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There's no downsizing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I, but if there were, I'd be protected as assistant regional manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Assistant to the regional manager Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, so I don't have to worry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look, look, look. I talked to corporate, about protecting the sales staff. And they said they couldn't guarantee it if there's downsizing, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But there's no downsizing, so just don't...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Bottom line. Do I need to be worried?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mmm, mm, mm. Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It looks like there's gonna be downsizing. And it's part of my job, but... blah! I hate it. I think the main difference between me and Donald Trump is that, uh, I get no pleasure out of saying the words, "You're fired." [as Donald Trump] "You're foir-ed. Uh, you're foir-ed." It just makes people sad, and an office can't function that way. No way. [as Donald Trump] "You're foir-ed."  I think if I had a catchphrase it would be, "You're hired, and you can work here as long as you want." But that's unrealistic, so...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's a real shame, 'cause studies have shown that more information gets passed through water-cooler gossip than through official memos. Which puts me at a disadvantage, because I bring my own water to work.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Why'd you do this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I didn't do it. What do you mean? Oh, the water cooler was brought over here for... maintenance. So what do you guys hear? What's the scuttlebutt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Get set for Operation Morale Improvement starring Michael Scott. Now, I think I have had a little stroke of genius in that I have had my assistant Pam... Smile, Pam. I have had her go out and find out whose birthday is coming up, so we can have a little celebration for it. Not bad, not bad at all. All right. And the birthday person is... drum roll please. Here we go, who is the birthday, birthday person?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who is it? Who's the birthday?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um... Actually, we don't have any staff birthdays coming up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Next person on the...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...calendar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, umm... that would be Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes! All right, come on down Meredith!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: But it's not until next month.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um... uh, OK. Well, great, well, you know, it'll be a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You still want to have a party?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, why not? Sure. Go ahead, live a little. Come on, Pam. Come on, shake it up. Shake it up! Shake it up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [grabs cell phone off desk] Brrrp! Uh, Spock, are there any signs of life down there? Well, let me check Captain. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. No, Captain. No signs of life down here. Just a wet blanket named Pam. Brr-rrrp. Star Trek.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Well, uh, for decorations, maybe we could... it's stupid, forget it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I was just going to say, maybe we could have streamers, but that's dumb, everybody has streamers. Never mind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, yeah, I think that's a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What color do you guys think?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Well, there's green, um, blue... yellow... red...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How about green?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I think green is kind of whoreish.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: This was tough. I suggested we flip a coin. But Angela said she doesn't like to gamble. Of course by saying that she was gambling that I wouldn't smack her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: These are my party-planning beeyatches. Pulled off an amazing '80s party last year. Off the hook!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So I was thinking, if you haven't already got a cake, um, maybe going for one of those ice-cream cakes from Baskin-Robbins. Those are very good. Very Delicious.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Meredith's allergic to dairy, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She's not the only one that's going to be eating it, right? I think everybody likes ice-cream cake. It's not, uh, it's not just about her, so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It is... her birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mint chocolate chip! That'd be good, how about some, mint chocolate chip?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, so listen, I was thinking that it might be a good idea if you and I formed an alliance. 'Cause of the downsizing? I think an alliance might be a good idea, you know. Help each other out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do you want to form, an alliance, with me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Absolutely, I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good, good. Excellent, OK. Now we need to figure out who's vulnerable and who's protected...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: At that moment, I was so happy. I mean, everything Dwight does annoys me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Did you get your tickets?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: To what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The gun show. [Rolls up his sleeve and kisses his bicep]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And I spend hours thinking of ways to get back at him, but only in ways that could get me arrested. And then here he comes and he says "No, Jim, here's a way."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There's one other thing and this is important. Let's keep this alliance totally a secret. Don't tell anyone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: An alliance?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What does that even mean?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think it has something to do with Survivor, but I'm not sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Um, I know that it involves spying on people and we may build a fort, underground.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim! Hey. Hi, Pam. Listen, could I talk to you a second about the... paper products?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Did you tell Pam about the alliance?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What? No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What? Oh no no no. Dwight, no. I'm using her, for the alliance. Who knows the most information about this office? Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Right, that's good, good, pursue this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well I'm trying to. Do you see what I'm doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: But listen, I'm going to have to talk to her a lot. All right? And there may be chatting, and giggling. And you gotta just pretend to ignore it. Wipe it away.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [to the camera] Can you get her? She's right there. [camera zooms in on Meredith at here desk] That is Meredith, the birthday girl. And this... is Meredith's card. Happy Bird-Day. [laughs] Um, let's see. Jim, Jim wrote, "Meredith, I heard you're turning 46, but, come on, you're an accountant. Just fudge the numbers." Not bad, pretty funny, I don't appreciate condoning corporate fraud though. Uh, here's the thing. Whatever I write here has to be really, really funny. Because people out there are expecting it. I've already set the bar really high. And they're all worried about their jobs, you know. It's kinda dark out there. Can you imagine if I wrote something like, uh, "Oh, Meredith. Happy Birthday. You're great. Love, Michael." [pretends to vomit and laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They seem awfully chummy, don't you think?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, what do you think that's about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Only one way to find out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You are not going to believe this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What? I believe it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, tensions were high in the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I could tell, from the body language.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey Kev, that looks good. What is it? Turkey?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Italian.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, Italian. Nice. Wow! You got the works there. Red onion, provolone...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Toby and Kevin, they're trying to get Angela kicked off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good, let 'em. It helps our cause.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, I don't know, if Kevin's in accounting, and Toby's in Human Resources and they're talking...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, they're forming an alliance

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I love their sandwiches.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I love their sandwiches too.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Their bread's really good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Their bread is very good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Damn it. God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, listen, we need to assume that everyone in the office is forming an alliance and is therefore trying to get us kicked off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: God... Damn it! Why us?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because we're strong, Dwight. Because we're strong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [staring at birthday card] Meredith, Meredith... Meri... Mary had a little lamb. Mary... Meredith had a little lamb. Don't bring that lamb to work or it'll poop on the floor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Oscar! Come on in. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Uh, I'm sorry to bother you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, not at all. Come on in. What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: My nephew is involved with, um, a charity for cerebral palsy, and I was wondering if maybe you'd like to... you know... if...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Donate to the charity?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, God. Of course I would. Get it over here. Get that over here.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I'm always good... for some serious buckage. Wow. Two dollars, three dollars? People out here do not care about diseases. I am going to give you... $25.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: That's... that's... that's very generous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, my gosh, well... Listen, Oscar, generosity and togetherness and community all convalescences into... morale. That's what I say, so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispering] Hey, Jim, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um, I don't know, I'm just like, I'm going a little crazy 'cause I keep overhearing all these conversations between Michael and corporate about like, staff issues?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh no?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, he's making me take notes on these meetings and I'm, like, "These people are my friends." But he's all like, "This is confidential. You can't tell anybody." But I just feel like I want to... aaah. Just promise me you're not gonna say anything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, will not, I'm not going to tell anybody. This is between you and me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jackpot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That was beautiful. All her idea too. Awesome. She is so great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [looking at birthday card] Meredith, bad breath. Meredith has bad breath.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, you wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. What do you know about Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don't think she'd be missed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There's not going to be downsizing Dwight, OK? I just, I need to know a little bit more about my friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Name, Meredith Palmer. Uh, personal information, divorced twice, two kids. Uh, Employer, Dunder Mifflin Paper Incorporated. Awards, multiple Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know all that. I know all that. I just, I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: She had a hysterectomy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs] Which one is that again?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's where they remove the uterus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh God! Dwight, no. I'm trying to write something funny. What am I going to do with a removed uterus?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It could be kind of funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what, I am on a deadline here, and just... OK. Thanks, thanks for your help. I'll work it out. Thank you Dwight. That was a waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, here's the deal. All right? Pam says that one of the alliances is meeting in the warehouse during Meredith's birthday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh my God, we have to be there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I know, but it's gonna be a little tough because there's no good place to hide there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No no, yes there is. Behind the shelves. Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What? What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know. I know exactly what to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [gives Dwight a high five] Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm a deer hunter. I go all the time with my dad. One thing about deer, they have very good vision. One thing about me, I am better at hiding than they are... at vision.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is going to be perfect, OK? Centrally located. Perfect cover. I can hear and see everything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Michael? Are you done yet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Almost there. Just a sec. Just a second. It is perfect, thank you. Excellent, here we go. It is time, thank you. OK, come on. Let's go! Get the cake. Here we go. Come on! Shhh. Be quiet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait, this isn't gonna work. The lid's open.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So tape it down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I can't do that. You won't be able to breathe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Look, I can breathe just fine. OK, but if it makes you feel better, I'll poke holes in the box.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thank you, thank you. OK.

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.line: Surprise!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Oh! Surprise.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, it's ah...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's surprise Meredith. One, two...

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.line: [tunelessly] Happy birthday to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Find a key.

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.line: Happy birthday...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So do you want me to stay here and, you know, stand next to the box?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, you need to go upstairs to the party so people don't notice we're both gone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right... That's good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can I trust Jim? I don't know. Do I have a choice? No, frankly, I don't. Will I trust Jim? Yes. Should I trust Jim? You tell me.

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.line: [singing] ... birthday, dear Meredith Happy birthday to you...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And many more!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Last year, five years ago...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You were surprised, weren't you?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You looked freaked, man. We said "Surprise." You were, like, "What?" "What the hell's goin' on here?" Good cake. Why don't you have some?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Uh, I can't. Um...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on. A little bit.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I can't eat dairy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, right. God, too bad. It's so good.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah, it makes me sick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what? If I were allergic to dairy, I think I'd kill myself. 'Cause this is way, way too good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He's in a box?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam, he's in a box. He's downstairs, in a box, on the floor, near the shelves. I'm serious. Go down there and work your magic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [on her cell phone] Hey where are you? Yeah, we were supposed to meet here. What? Oh my gosh! That ties in perfectly with something that Michael was telling me earlier! I just don't know what some of the people in, like, accounting are going to do? It said specifically that...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [box falls over] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jim, good party, huh? Just a little something I whipped up. You know, a little morale boost. No big deal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Speaking of which, I meant to tell you. Very impressive, the uh, donation you gave to Oscar's charity. What was it? 25 bucks?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, you know, money isn't everything Jim. It's not the key to happiness. You know what is? Joy. You should remember that. Maybe you'll give more than three dollars next time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, well, three dollars a mile. It's gonna end up being like 50 bucks. So... God, I can't even calculate what you're gonna have to give.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Is Oscar around?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I just thought it was kind of a flat, you know... 25 dollar, one-time donation. I didn't think it was per mile kinda deal. You know, so...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well, that's what a walk-a-thon is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It says it right on the sheet. Look, look at the sheet. It says, "However many dollars per mile."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Right. Got it. Yes. So it does. Um...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I just think it's kind of cheap to un-donate money to a charity.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, no. That wasn't what I wasn't, that wasn't... No. It-it-it's not about the money. It's just... it... it's the ethics of the thing, Oscar. How's your nephew? Is he in good shape?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How many miles did he do last year?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Last year, he walked 18 miles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Son of a bitch. That is impressive.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Happy Birthday. [gives Meredith her card]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Read it out loud. And say who wrote everything so we know whose is the best.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: "Happy Bird-day" Um... "Meredith, good news. You're not actually a year older because you work here, where time stands still."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [under his breath] I don't know about that.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: That was Stanley. "Meredith, happy birthday, you're the best. Love, Pam."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [pretends to vomit] Huh! Thanks, downer.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: This is from Michael. "Meredith, let's hope the only downsizing that happens to you is that someone downsizes your age."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because of the downsizing. Rumors. And because you're gettin' old.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No, I... I get it. It's funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs] You didn't get the joke. So, that's cool. That's, you know what? Actually... I have a bunch of these, good ones, that I didn't use. Um... Oh, where's that? Oh, OK, here's a good one. Um... "Hey Meredith, Liz Taylor called, she wants her age back and her divorces back." 'Cause Meredith's been divorced like, twice. Is that right?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: You're right. You're right. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Divorce. Um... OK, "Meredith is so old..."

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everybody? If... could do it? "Meredith is so old..."

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.line: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: "She's so old, she went into an antique store and they kept her."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That wasn't even mine. I got that off the Internet. Website. Um, don't get mad at me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Uh, nice party Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This isn't my fault. Ladies, not your best effort. The streamers?  I think we could have done better than that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Phyllis wanted red, I didn't.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, boy... You...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, we... all right. People, hold on, hold on. Just a second. OK, I think we're losing sight of what is really important here. And that is that we are... a group of people... who work together. I was... I really wasn't gonna flaunt this. I have made a very sizable donation to Oscar's nephew's... walkathon. $25.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Per mile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Per mile, yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: When I retire, I... don't want to just disappear to an island somewhere. I wanna be the guy who gives everything back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A check for the kids, and for the team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I want it to be like... "Hey, who donated that hospital wing that is saving so many lives?" "Um, well, I don't, I don't know. It was anonymous." "Well, guess what, [whispering] that was Michael Scott."  "But it was anonymous, how do you know?" "Because I'm him."

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come here. [hugs Oscar and In a low voice] Don't cash that till Friday, OK?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Really? Today?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, Happy Birthday.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah, I could say something.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No, don't. Don't do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, OK. I have something that totally tops the box.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, tell me, tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK. I have just convinced Dwight that he needs to go to Stamford and... [Pam starts laughing]... spy on our other branch. No no no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: But before he does so, I told him that he should dye his hair to go undercover.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [laughing] That's perfect!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: If we can get him to drive to Connecticut... and put peroxide in his hair...

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: [yelling] What the hell is this? What are you trying to cop a feel or something? Huh Halpert?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, no, dude, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, dude, no, I was just, listen! Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: God, I don't even, I don't even know how to explain this. Uh, um... Dwight, uh, asked me to be in an alliance. And then um... um... we were... we've just been messing with him. Uh, because of the whole alliance thing. Um...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's just office pranks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's stupid. It's, it's just office pranks.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: [looking at Dwight] An alliance? What the hell is he talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have absolutely no idea.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do I feel bad about betraying Jim? Not at all. That's the game. Convince him we're in an alliance, get some information, throw him to the wolves.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [With blonde hair] That's politics baby. Get what you can out of someone, then crush them. I think Jim might have learned a very valuable lesson.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good, excellent, and file sharing off and done. Security software, 128-bit encryption, firewalls. Get up, I'll install it on your computer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pssh, stupid. Identity theft happens all the time. I can become you like that. [snaps fingers] But no one can become me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No one wants to be you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Not true. And if they did, they couldn't because I'm password protected.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is your password Frodo?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. [typing on keyboard]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Did you just change it to Gollum?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. [typing on keyboard]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [telephone rings] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Hold please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All righty then, well I see you're going for the whole bored supermodel thing. "Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. May I help you?" [takes a drag from an imaginary cigarette] Smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I wasn't really going for anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no. I get it, I get it, I get it. A child is born, "Oh, oh-hum." A beautiful sunset, "No, I'll catch the next one." Right? Unicorn walks into the office, "Oh, do you have an appointment?" [laughs] Okay, look Pam this is not meant as a criticism, but let me tell you what you're doing wrong. You are the voice of this company, right? And when clients call and you're not smiling they can hear that in your voice. It is a real turnoff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Are you being serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, I am, absolutely. So, the next call we get I'd like you to smile. I'd like to see a big smile.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. [waits for call]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No one's calling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, somebody will. And we'll wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sometimes there's a lot of time between the calls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, I know, we will wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We will wait for the call and you will smile.  Let me try something, just while we're waiting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Tell me if I'm smiling or not. [covers face with hands] Hi Pam, how are you? Was I smiling?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, let me try this one. [covers face with hands] Hi Pam, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I mean you can tell.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I could tell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I wasn't smiling that time and they can tell too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That was a good example.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you. All right, when we get a call I'll come back and you'll do the smile.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay. [telephone rings]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Show time! It's show time!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [smiling] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. One moment I'll transfer you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [throwing away a banana, mayonnaise, and a sandwich from the refrigerator, smells the mayonnaise] God. [drinks from the milk carton and puts it back] Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [looks in  the refrigerator] Hey Dwight, my tuna sandwich isn't in the refrigerator. You wouldn't know anything about that would you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It was rotting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It was not rotting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Any employee may dispose a food item...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Stop. Dwight, stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ...that risks contaminating the other food item. Read the official kitchen regulations memo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight, you wrote that memo. Okay, it's not an official memo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh, uh, not my problem. Okay, this is a paper factory not a bacteria factory.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight, it's not a factory at all. Do you have to do what you are doing? [Dwight is tapping each of the bobble heads on his desk and making them bobble]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh, if they don't bobble, what's the point?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: My nephew does it every year. Anything you could give would be fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay, but I don't want to be put on a mailing list.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We need to assume that everyone in the office is forming an alliance and is therefore trying to get us kicked off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: God... Damn it! Why us?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because we're strong, Dwight. Because we're strong. God, it's freezing, I gotta go in. You stay though for like five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [talking over Jim] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You don't want to arouse suspicion.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'll stay for ten.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good. I like it. You know what. Pretend to smoke. [Dwight pretends to smoke]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do a poem for Meredith's birthday or uh, limerick. Limerick. Um, [knock on  door] there was a girl from Dunder Mifflin. Come on in. Who had a big, smifflin.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hi, do you mind if I sign the card real quick?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, not at all come on in. [Toby signing the birthday card] No, no. You can't. No, red hair is my area. We have it on tape, so...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It's just a birthday card.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I was going to put that in my message, Toby. All right? So just cross it off. Cross it off, now. [Toby writes on birthday card] What are you doing? Oh come on, you're ruining it. Toby, come on.  Just, look at that. That's wrecked. Ass. Get some white out.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: There's some right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's my white out. Get your own white out. Just... what's the matter with you? God. [Toby leaves] Okay, um, there was a girl from Dunder Mifflin. Who had a big, puttifflin. [thinking out loud] Mifflin, spifflin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, by the way. Have you heard Dwight say the word immunity, yet? Because if I can get Dwight to say the word immunity, it might be the greatest day of my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, yeah. What do you know about Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don't think she'd be missed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There's not going to be downsizing Dwight, OK? I just, I need to know a little bit more about my friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Name, Meredith Palmer. Uh, personal information, divorced twice, two kids. Uh, Employer, Dunder Mifflin Paper Incorporated. Awards, multiple Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know all that. I know all that. I just, I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: She had a hysterectomy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Which one is that again?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's where they remove the uterus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh God! Dwight, no. I'm trying to write something funny here, okay. What am I going to do with a removed uterus?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It could be kind of funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs] Come up with a joke that I can use, okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Help me out here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. Hey Meredith, where's your uterus?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, not a uterus joke Dwight. Please. Something useable. A joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If I find a joke for you, will you grant me immunity? [cut to Jim holding his hands up like a champion]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: From the downsizing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There's not going to be downsizing, Dwight. You know what, I am on a deadline here and just, okay. Thanks. Thanks for your help. I'm... I'll work it out. Thank you Dwight. [Dwight leaves] Thanks for coming in, that's always... Always helpful when I give him a call. Call him in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Meredith. Oh, oh man, ah gosh. I can't remember why I came over here. Ha, ha.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I hate that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know. Ugh, that is so annoying. [makes fart noise] Brain fart. By the way, do you remember any funny interactions we may have had recently that I've forgotten about? Just, you know we  bumped into each and you said, "Brr, brr." And I went, "Argh, Argh." You know? Anything? [shakes her head 'no'] Well, if you think of something, let me know. 'Cause I like to know. 'Cause I'm going crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oscar, uh for future reference just think you should know, that you should probably make it clear that your nephew is doing the walkathon and that he doesn't actually have cerebral palsy. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I never suggested...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no. I know you didn't intend to, but I just I got the idea and I, uh, I just don't it has a lot of ethical merit to make people think something. You know? And then prey on their emotions.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael, if I gave you...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, hey  it's just kinda uncool, okay? I, just... Play fair, you know, play fair.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: "Meredith, let's hope the only downsizing that happens to you is that someone downsizes your age."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because of the downsizing. Rumors. And because you're gettin' old.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No, I...I get it. It's funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs] You didn't get the joke. So, that's cool. That's, you know what? Actually... I have a bunch of these, good ones, that I didn't use. Um... Oh, where's that? Oh, Okay, here's a good one. Um..."Hey Meredith, Liz Taylor called, she wants her age back and her divorces back." 'Cause Meredith's been divorced like, twice. Is that right?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: You're right. You're right. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Divorce. Um... Okay, "Meredith is so old..."

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If everybody... could do it? "Meredith is so old..."

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.line: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: "She's so old, she went into an antique store and they kept her."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [clears throat] What's the difference between Meredith and Michael Jackson? Michael Jackson's surgery was unnecessary.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: You're talking about my hysterectomy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes! Thank you. God. She gets it. [laughs] We just picked the best one right? Just had it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispering] I'm so sorry. [Angela, Phyllis, and Pam all whispering] ... seriously, we're just...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um, no, no. Come on. No. Don't comfort... don't comfort her, that's not... She doesn't need comforting. We're just joking around. I think she's... No that's very unprofessional. I think she's being very unprofessional over there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm only going to ask you this once. Are you part of an alliance?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well played.
